content:
18 Ways to Clear Your Browser's Cache - wikiHow 
 Home Random Browse Articles Add to This Page Add Tip Easy Ways to Help Approve Questions Review Tech Feedback Fix Spelling More Things to Try...   
 Log in / Sign up   
 Desktop Site   
 Talk How to Clear Your Browser's Cache   
 Your internet browser's cache stores certain information (snapshots) of webpages you visit on your computer or mobile device so that they'll load more quickly upon future visits and while navigating through websites that use the same images on multiple pages so that you do not download the same image multiple times. Occasionally, however your cache can prevent you from seeing updated content, or cause functional problems when stored content conflicts with live content. You can fix many browser problems simply by clearing your cache. This article contains instructions with screenshots on how to clear the cache for all major browsers. 
 If you are unsure of what browser version you are currently using, you can visit  whatbrowser.org  to find out. 
 Steps Edit 
 Method One of 18: Chrome v10+ Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a3\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-1-Version-6.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-1-Version-6.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a3\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-1-Version-6.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-1-Version-6.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Open the settings on Chrome.  Click the menu icon in the upper right corner of the browser to the right. Click settings on the bottom of the menu.
 A faster way to get there is to press  Control + ⇧  Shift + Delete  on a PC, or if you're using a Mac  ⇧  Shift + ⌘  Command + Delete . 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/ce\/Google-chrome-settings%3B-adavanced.png\/459px-Google-chrome-settings%3B-adavanced.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/ce\/Google-chrome-settings%3B-adavanced.png\/759px-Google-chrome-settings%3B-adavanced.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":227.47252747253,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":375.82417582418} 
 2 
 From settings, click "Advanced".  It's located at the very bottom of the settings section.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/3c\/Clear-browsing-data%3B-chrome-2017.png\/460px-Clear-browsing-data%3B-chrome-2017.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/3c\/Clear-browsing-data%3B-chrome-2017.png\/760px-Clear-browsing-data%3B-chrome-2017.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":326.67582417582,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":539.72527472527} 
 3 
 Scroll to the 'Privacy and security' section and click "Clear browsing data". 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5a\/Clear-cache%3B-chrome.png\/459px-Clear-cache%3B-chrome.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/5\/5a\/Clear-cache%3B-chrome.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":399.37984496124,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":659.84496124031} 
 4 
 Select "Cached images and files".  Uncheck all other options to avoid deleting browser history, cookies and other things you may wish to retain. Change "Obliterate the following items from" to "the beginning of time".
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fc\/Clear-browsing-data%3B-google-chrome.png\/459px-Clear-browsing-data%3B-google-chrome.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/fc\/Clear-browsing-data%3B-google-chrome.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":399.37984496124,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":659.84496124031} 
 5 
 Press "Clear browsing data".  You are done!
 Advertisement 
 Method Two of 18: Firefox 33 Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fe\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-46-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-46-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fe\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-46-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-46-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Click the Menu button ("hamburger button" - the one with three horizontal lines) and then choose Options. 
 If Options is not listed in the menu, click Customize and drag Options from the list of Additional Tools and Features over to the Menu. 
 Note: If you're using the menu bar, choose Tools and then Options instead. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/eb\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-47-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-47-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/eb\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-47-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-47-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 Firefox for Mac:  On a Mac, choose Preferences from the Firefox menu and then continue as instructed below. With the Options window now open, click the Privacy tab. In the History area, click the clear your recent history link.
 If you don't see that link, change the Firefox will: option to Remember history. You can change it back to your custom setting when you're done. In the Clear Recent History window that appears, set the Time range to clear: to Everything. In the list at the bottom of the window, uncheck everything except for Cache. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/3d\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-48-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-48-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/3d\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-48-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-48-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 3 
 If you wish to clear other kinds of stored data, feel free to check the appropriate boxes.  They will be cleared with the cache in the next step.
 Don't see anything to check? Click the button next to Details. Click on the Clear Now button. When the Clear Recent History window disappears, all of the files saved (cached) from your Internet browsing activities in Firefox will have been removed. 
 If your Internet cache is large, Firefox may hang while it finishes removing the files. Just be patient - it will eventually finish the job. 
 Older versions of Firefox, particularly Firefox 4 through Firefox 33, have fairly similar processes for clearing the cache but please try to keep Firefox updated to the latest version if you can. 
 Advertisement 
 Method Three of 18: Safari for Mac OS X Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/24\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-14-Version-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-14-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/24\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-14-Version-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-14-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345.63186813187,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":571.04395604396} 
 1 
 Once your browser is open, click the  Safari  menu and select  Empty Cache. .. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/37\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-15-Version-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-15-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/37\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-15-Version-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-15-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 Click  Empty . 
 Advertisement 
 Method Four of 18: Internet Explorer 9, 10, and 11 Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f4\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-20-Version-6.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-20-Version-6.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f4\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-20-Version-6.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-20-Version-6.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Once your browser is open, click the gear icon at the top right to open the  Settings  menu.  Then, select  Safety  and  Delete Browsing History.... 
 Or, alternately, you may simply press  Ctrl + ⇧  Shift + Delete  to open the Delete Browsing History window. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c3\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-21-Version-6.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-21-Version-6.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c3\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-21-Version-6.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-21-Version-6.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 Select  Temporary Internet Files .  You will also need to  uncheck  all of the other boxes, especially  Preserve Favorites website data . This option makes the window also delete objects from websites in your Favorites folder, which is necessary to completely clear your cache.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f9\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-22-Version-6.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-22-Version-6.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f9\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-22-Version-6.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-22-Version-6.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 3 
 Click the  Delete  button near the bottom of the window to perform the operations (i.e.  clear your cache by deleting temporary files).
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f3\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-23-Version-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-23-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f3\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-23-Version-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-23-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 4 
 Your computer will work for a moment, and then the process will be complete.  You've successfully cleared Internet Explorer 9's Cache!
 Advertisement 
 Method Five of 18: Microsoft Edge Edit 
 1 
 Click the Edge Menu button  (. ..) and select Settings.  This will open the Settings sidebar. 
 2 
 Click the "Choose what to clear" button.  You'll find this under the "Clear browsing data" heading. 
 3 
 Ensure "Cached data and files" is checked.  This is usually selected by default. 
 4 
 Review the list of items to be cleared.  Everything that is checked will be removed, so review the list and select or deselect any of the items. 
 5 
 Click "Clear" to delete the checked items.  As long as "Cached data and files" is checked, your Edge browser cache will be deleted. 
 Advertisement 
 Method Six of 18: Safari for Windows Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/50\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-16-Version-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-16-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/50\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-16-Version-5.jpg\/v4-759px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-16-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344.36813186813,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":568.95604395604} 
 1 
 Once your browser is open, click the gear icon on the top right. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/93\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-17-Version-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-17-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/93\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-17-Version-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-17-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 Select "Reset Safari . .."  This will prompt a screen to open.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/77\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-18-Version-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-18-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/77\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-18-Version-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-18-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 3 
 Select "Remove all website data" at the very bottom of the prompt.  Check or uncheck any other categories you want reset.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/09\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-19-Version-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-19-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/09\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-19-Version-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-19-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 4 
 Click "Reset". 
 Advertisement 
 Method Seven of 18: Internet Explorer 8 Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/36\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-24-Version-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-24-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/36\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-24-Version-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-24-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Once your browser is open, click the  Tools  menu.  Or, optionally you may simply press  Ctrl + ⇧  Shift + Delete  to open the Delete Browsing History window (and skip step 2)
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/30\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-25-Version-5.jpg\/v4-459px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-25-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/30\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-25-Version-5.jpg\/v4-759px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-25-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":354.82093663912,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":586.2258953168} 
 2 
 Click on  Delete Browsing History. .. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/45\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-26-Version-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-26-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/45\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-26-Version-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-26-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 3 
 Select  Temporary Internet Files . 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d7\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-27-Version-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-27-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d7\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-27-Version-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-27-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 4 
 Click the  Delete  button near the bottom of the window to delete your temporary files (i.e.  clear your cache).
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1b\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-28-Version-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-28-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1b\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-28-Version-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-28-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 5 
 Set your cache to delete every time you close Internet Explorer.  If you want the browser to automatically clear the cache whenever you close it, close the 'Delete Browsing History' window, select 'Internet Options' from the Tools menu, and check the 'Delete Browsing history on exit' checkbox.
 Note: IE8 has a "feature" which retains some cookies even after you clear your cache if you do not UNCHECK the "Preserve Favorites Website Data." If you truly need to clear your cache, you will want to uncheck this! 
 Advertisement 
 Method Eight of 18: Internet Explorer 7 Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/35\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-29-Version-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-29-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/35\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-29-Version-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-29-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345.63186813187,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":571.04395604396} 
 1 
 Open IE 7 and click the  Tools  menu.  Click the  Delete Browsing History  link at the top.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/e0\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-30-Version-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-30-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/e0\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-30-Version-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-30-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 Under the  Temporary Internet Files  heading, click  Delete files. .. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/00\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-31-Version-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-31-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/00\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-31-Version-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-31-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 3 
 Click  Yes  when you see the prompt asking if you are sure you want to delete all temporary files. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c7\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-32-Version-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-32-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c7\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-32-Version-5.jpg\/v4-759px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-32-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344.36813186813,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":568.95604395604} 
 4 
 Alternatively, clear your cache for just the current page you're visiting.  Press and hold  Ctrl  on your keyboard, then Press  F5  or click on the Refresh button (square button on the toolbar with opposite-facing arrows).
 Advertisement 
 Method Nine of 18: Firefox 30+ Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/72\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-37-Version-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-37-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/72\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-37-Version-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-37-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Go to the most right button on the toolbar: 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f7\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-38-Version-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-38-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f7\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-38-Version-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-38-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 Click the "Options" button (That one with a gear).  The options dialog appears.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2b\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-39-Version-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-39-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2b\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-39-Version-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-39-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 3 
 Select the Advanced button and then the "Network" tab. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/0e\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-40-Version-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-40-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/0e\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-40-Version-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-40-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 4 
 After that push the "Clear Now" button inside the "Cached Web Content" section.  Then restart or close and reopen Firefox.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/b0\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-41-Version-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-41-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/b0\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-41-Version-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-41-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 5 
 Another way to clear cache is pressing  Ctrl + ⇧  Shift + Delete  to open the recent history window. 
 On a Mac, you can press  ⇧  Shift + ⌘  Command + Delete . 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/cc\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-42-Version-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-42-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/cc\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-42-Version-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-42-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 6 
 Make sure "Details" is expanded, then select "Cache" from the list.  Uncheck everything else.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1f\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-43-Version-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-43-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1f\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-43-Version-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-43-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 7 
 In the  "Time Range to Clear"  drop down, select "Everything". 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/51\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-44-Version-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-44-Version-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/51\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-44-Version-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-44-Version-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 8 
 Select  "Clear Now" .  Your computer will work for a moment, and the process will be completed.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d1\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-45-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-45-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d1\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-45-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-45-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 9 
 Restart or close and reopen Firefox.  You've successfully cleared Firefox's Cache!
 Advertisement 
 Method Ten of 18: Firefox 4 Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/56\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-33-Version-6.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-33-Version-6.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/56\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-33-Version-6.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-33-Version-6.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Go to "Clear Recent History": 
 On a PC, click the "Firefox" menu in the top left corner. Next, select the right arrow next to "History >", and click "Clear Recent History"
 Or press  Ctrl + ⇧  Shift + Delete  to open the recent history window. 
 On a Mac, from the Tools menu, select "Clear Recent History…"
 Alternately, you can press  ⇧  Shift + ⌘  Command + Delete . 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/0e\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-34-Version-6.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-34-Version-6.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/0e\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-34-Version-6.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-34-Version-6.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 Make sure "Details" is expanded, then select "Cache" from the list.  Uncheck everything else.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/42\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-35-Version-6.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-35-Version-6.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/42\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-35-Version-6.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-35-Version-6.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 3 
 In the  "Time Range to Clear"  drop down, select "Everything". 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/9f\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-36-Version-6.jpg\/v4-460px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-36-Version-6.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/9f\/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-36-Version-6.jpg\/v4-760px-Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache-Step-36-Version-6.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 4 
 Select  "Clear Now" .  Your computer will work for a moment, and the process will be complete. You've successfully cleared Firefox's Cache!

 How do I clear my cache on my iPhone 6s? 
								Answered by  
								wikiHow Contributor							 
 Open settings, then go to Safari, then select clear browser history.

 I am using Firefox 45, so how do I clear the Cache? 
								Answered by  
								wikiHow Contributor							 
 From the History menu, select Clear Recent History. If the menu bar is hidden, press Alt to make it visible. From the Time Range to Clear: drop-down menu, select the desired range; to clear your entire cache, select Everything. Next to "Details", click the down arrow to choose which elements of the history to clear; to clear your entire cache, select all items. Click Clear Now. Exit/quit all browser windows and re-open the browser. 
 Thanks!

 6 
 How do I refresh a web page? 
								Answered by  
								wikiHow Contributor							 
 This depends on your web browser, but most have a small icon that looks like an arrow somewhere near the address bar. 
 Thanks!

 How can I figure out which version of Firefox I have installed? 
								Answered by  
								wikiHow Contributor							 
 Right click the top of the Firefox window, click Menu Bar, click Help, About Firefox. Under the Firefox logo, it will say Firefox and then a number. That is the version you have. 
 Thanks!

 Warnings Edit 
 Deleting your browser's cache is NOT the same as deleting cookies. See  How to Clear Your Browser's Cookies  for help deleting cookies.

 Tips Edit 
 You can use  Portable Firefox  from a USB flash drive, which will store the data (cache, cookies, etc.) on the portable device, rather than your computer's hard drive. 
 16 
 Helpful? 
   3 
 If you wish, you can disable the cache entirely in your browser's options panel by choosing the 'do not remember history' option or simply browse incognito. The cache is used to speed up access to websites by loading data from the local memory rather than downloading it, however you probably will not notice a difference from a high-speed internet connection.
